Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2023037557.CaseDesc: On July 13, 2023, Travis McDuffie was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.  Reports have been received of possible sightings of Travis at several businesses located in the 3200 to 5100 blocks of 17 Avenue S.E., Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Scar: Right Abdomen

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns
Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.
Scar: Forehead, 25mm

Case reference: 2014003135.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1986, Herman Yahyahkeekoot was last seen at his residence, a farm which was a group home.  Mr. Yahyahkeekoot had a history of wandering away from the home. The location is close to the Nesbit Forest which was searched, however, he was never located.

Case reference: 2014002329.CaseDesc: Blair Henry Yensen left his residence in the town of Capreol on January 7th, 1992. He was last seen walking on Ski Hill Road. He has a noticeable limp, walks with a cane and has a shoe insert in his left shoe. He smokes very heavily. He suffers from severe depression, seems to be quite religious, and speaks in a religious manner.

Jacket: Fishing Jacket, blue with yellow and gold lettering on the front and back.

Case reference: 2014001410.CaseDesc: Emma Dixon was last seen on July 22, 1964 at her home on Union Bar Reserve, in Hope, British Columbia. Her husband said that she may have gone to Washington for work. Emma never told anyone she was leaving and did not take any personal belongings. She was reported missing on August 20, 1964.

Case reference: 2018029824.CaseDesc: Azizollah Nabizadeh was reported missing on April 30, 2018, by his mother, who resides in Sweden. Azizollah had informed her that he was residing in Toronto, Ontario when last they spoke 7 years prior. The last evidence police could find of Azizollah in Canada dates back to 1995.

Scar: Mouth, Small scar below the mouth

Case reference: 2014005651.CaseDesc: On May 10th 1969, Lorie Lewis, 7, was reported missing from the city of Squamish. She was last seen on the same day by her siblings of similar age, playing near a beach on the Cheekeye River, upstream of its confluence with the Cheakamus River. At the time, the water run off was swift, and Lorie is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2018046052.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1997, Eric Wong was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Eric was in Canada continuing his education and had contacted his mother in October 1997 for help with his tuition fees.

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.
Scar: Right Hip, Laparotomy scar (Appendectomy)

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2022041871.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1994, Johnny Baker was seen for the last time at his residence in Borger Texas, USA.

Scar: Left Eye, Over the left eye

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2014002600.CaseDesc: On April 10th, 1976, at approximately 3:00 am, a snowmobile carrying two adults and a young child, went through harbor ice at North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. The young child, Stella Mary Rich, was swept under the ice after falling off the snowmobile when it struck a soft spot in the ice. Her body has never been located and it is presumed she drowned.

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2014005179.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2006, Richard Griffis was seen for the last time when he went down to the White River in the remote community of Beaver Creek in the Yukon. Richard had been visiting from the United States, and had travelled to the Yukon to test out an outdoor survival suit that he invented.

Case reference: 2014005036.CaseDesc: Cory Bannerman was seen for the last time when he left work on November 26, 2007, in Edmonton, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, Cory was despondent.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs
Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim

Case reference: 2017045266.CaseDesc: On August 7, 2017, James Candy was reported missing from his residence north of Lavoy, Alberta. James was last seen in his bedroom the night before on August 6, 2017 at approximately 11:00 pm.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002926.CaseDesc: Maria Lindner was a passenger in a motor vehicle accident on February 22, 1980. Maria was not able to reach land when the vehicle entered the upper Niagara River.

Shoes: White, Nurses, Blue star and ribbed soles

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2020008397.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1981, Brian Orr was last seen by his parents in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Brian’s parents believe that he was in financial troubles.

Scar: Lower Left Back, 3 inches in length and half an inch wide
Right Eye, From nose to cheek bone on right eyelid

Case reference: 2024022215.CaseDesc: Jacob PENNER was last seen on May 6, 2024, near High Level, Alberta. RCMP are seeking the assistance of the public into information regarding PENNER's whereabouts.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears
Scar: Right Knee, 1 cm scar
Right Thigh, Scar 4x3 cm

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2014003345.CaseDesc: Tom Dobrowolsky was last seen leaving his Richmond, British Columbia, residence on February 21, 1981. Tom was originally from Montreal, Quebec, and had previously lived in various provinces across Canada.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Mark: Mouth, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Scar: Nose, Across nose
Left Leg, Varicose vein scars on both legs

Case reference: 2014005522.CaseDesc: Charlie Nguyen was seen for the last time on November 9, 2010 in the area of the foot bridge that connects Louise McKinney Park and Henrietta Edwards Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005187.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of December 29, 1960, Helga Kaserer was seen for the last time in the area of Harvard Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018062782.CaseDesc: On April 12, 1993, at approximately 4:30pm, Helen Bialowas was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014014065.CaseDesc: Ali Rizvi was last seen by his sister at a residence in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, on June 19th, 2014.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014003140.CaseDesc: Anthony Philip Porter was last seen on June 26, 1969 while he was picking up groceries near his home in the city of Kimberley, British Columbia. He never returned. Anthony is developmentally delayed.

Scar: Right Calf, Two inch scar on right shin
Head, Half inch scar over the right ear

Case reference: 2010003899.CaseDesc: Pierre Mercon, age 21, a lifelong resident of Vaughan, Ontario, was last seen at approximately 2:00 A.M. on November 1st, 1996. He was observed leaving the "Original Six" Sports Bar, located on Oxford Street in the Town of Richmond Hill, where he had attended a Halloween Party and was last seen wearing a costume of Army fatigues, work boots, a green wool hat and a long black wig. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Back of right shoulder, tattoo of Uruguay

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2014001532.CaseDesc: Gavin Edkins was last observed departing the Fort McMurray International Airport in Alberta on May 19, 1996, piloting a red and white Cessna aircraft bound for Red Deer, Alberta. The plane did not make it to its intended destination. Gavin and the plane haven't been located.

Coat: Leather, Black, With red liner - size 38
Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch, "Timex" brand
Gold, Gold, Chain, With float plane
Gold, Gold, Ring, On left pinky finger
Scar: Right Forearm, Cigar burns
Left Forearm, Cigar burns

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonnyville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020119.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1989, Francois Willey was seen for the last time in Chateauguay, Quebec. François has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Front Of Neck, Birthmark under Adam’s apple

Case reference: 2018067069.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2018, Akbar Syed was seen for the last time in the Table Rock area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Akbar was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: Leslie Anne Katnick was reported missing by her father on November 4, 1991, to Montreal Police. Leslie had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that Leslie registered into the Halifax, Nova Scotia YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Coat: Nylon, Blue, Helly Hansen, mountain coat
Jewelry: Gold, Necklace - gold eagle pendant, 1 IN
Metal, White, Watch - White Face Seiko, 8M2571000, SN 040792
Gold, Earring worn in left ear

Case reference: 2014002689.CaseDesc: Karel Szabo was last heard from in April or May of 1985, when he sent his mother, who lived in Czechoslovakia, a postcard from Los Angeles, California. Karel had written about his travels to Las Vegas and San Francisco. In November 1984, Karel had informed his family that he was going to Barrie, Ontario, to get a trucking job; when in fact he travelled to the United States.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Jaw, Lower right side jaw broken in 1982.
Scar: Waist, Dime sized surgical scar near the bellybutton.
Right Abdomen, Appendix scar

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2014004517.CaseDesc: Edmee (Eva) Mitchell, 83 years old, went missing on August 20, 2004. Mrs. Mitchell was last seen at her rural residence near Kelly Lake, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Scar: Right Knee
Left Wrist, Anterior

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2020007369.CaseDesc: On October 14, 1981, at approximately 9:00pm, May Mah was last seen by her nurse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2020028832.CaseDesc: On July 8th 2020, Tammy Nattaway was last seen in the north end of Garden Hill First Nation.

Case reference: 2019007755.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2019, Thomas, ‘Tommy’, Jones was seen for the last time travelling in a car with a male acquaintance around the community of Grand Falls-Windsor, Newfoundland. When Thomas did not return home later that evening, he was reported missing. According to the acquaintance, the car had run out of gas while traveling on a forest road behind the local mill. The acquaintance left to walk back to town and Thomas had decided to stay with the car. The car was located on the forest road but Thomas Jones was not located.

Case reference: 2022049190.CaseDesc: On September 28th, 2022, Joey Flett was seen for the last time after leaving a property in Gift Lake, Alberta. The vehicle Joey was reported to be driving was located at a rural location.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014024200.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2014, Noel Yassinsky was reported missing in Kitimat , British Columbia.  On September 17, 2014, Noel’s vehicle was located abandoned west of Prince George, near Purden Campground.  Noel’s disappearance is out of character and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Scar: Right Forearm

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Harold wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Paul and Richard are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Scar: Left Wrist, Approximately 2" long

Case reference: 2014003355.CaseDesc: Kelsey Brew and his friends were playing on the rocks on the shores of the Hudson Bay in Churchill. According to the witness Kelsey attempted to help another boy who had fallen in the water. As Kelsey was helping, a wave came in and he also slipped into the water. A large number of volunteers walked the shoreline and boat patrols failed to locate him. It is assumed Kelsey drowned.

Scar: Left Thumb
Cheek, 3 on left side of face

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2013000100.CaseDesc: On 25 August 1969, Murdo Baker left his camp to tend to his fishing nets in South Indian Lake, Manitoba. By 28 August he had not returned and the police were notified. His boat was recovered by police but his remains were never found. Murdo is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Right Leg, Several scars below knee

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2012020135.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1988, Melanie Temperton was reported missing. Melanie left her residence located in Mascouche, Quebec around 9:00 pm to go to Montreal, Quebec where she met friends in different places. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015012392.CaseDesc: Cuong Tu was last seen on March 11, 2015 on the south side of Edmonton, Alberta.  Cuong is described as being 5’4” tall and 124 pounds. He was last seen wearing black track pants, a black track-style jacket, and white runners.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2014002009.CaseDesc: Leroy Marshall, AKA Roy Marshall, has been missing since July 23, 1979. Mr. Marshall moved in with his sister on the west side of Saint John in June of 1979. He had a job interview with the School District on July 23, 1979 but failed to show. Mr. Marshall lived in Somerville, Massachusetts, US, between 1961 and 1971.

Scar: Abdomen, Appendix scar
Left Wrist, 2 inch
